body:
This is *very* strange -- it should basically be impossible for the path to be unset there, because the path is defined by the RPC method, and you can't actually start sending an RPC without invoking a method.

Do you have a way to reliably reproduce this, or is it flaky?

Can you try with the latest version of gRPC and see if it's still happening?

It is flaky, I cannot reliably reproduce this. It gets to coredumps from time to time. I suspect it is API misuse, but I cannot find a way to check it.

> Can you try with the latest version of gRPC and see if it's still happening?

No, unfortunately. grpc upgrade it very costly in my production environment. I can upgrade grpc in test env, but it is not reproducable in test env.

The source code of the framework is here: https://github.com/userver-framework/userver/tree/develop/grpc

Can you probably guess which kind of bug in user code might lead to such behaviour? I'll try to search for it or set tests/asserts in user code.

Unfortunately, I really have no idea what could cause this.  As I said, the only thing that I can think of that could cause this would be something removing the path metadata inside gRPC between the start of the call and the client channel filter.  But I don't see anywhere in our code base where we're doing anything like that, so unless you're injecting your own code inside gRPC, I don't know how this could happen.

In the absence of a reproduction, I'm afraid this bug report isn't actionable, so I'm going to close this.  But if you do find a way to reproduce it, please follow up, and we can reopen this.  Thanks!

Hi!
We've got some additional info on this, could you @markdroth please have a look?

----

Basically, we believe this is a race between retries and cancellation.
I did this (against 1.54.2): https://github.com/itrofimow/grpc/pull/1/files
and my reproducer crashed like this: https://pastebin.com/raw/txXSCUYB (notice the `arg` in frame 7)

This explains why we hit the assertion deeper down the call stack with the only field set in `send_initial_metadata_` being https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.54.2/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/retry_filter.cc#L1974: at that moment `send_initial_metadata_` cached in `CallData` is already cleared by cancellation, hence the empty `path`.

----

We vendor grpc at my workplace and this patch https://github.com/itrofimow/grpc/pull/2/files seems to fix the issue, but i'm not sure if it's the correct way to do it.

Thanks for this additional information -- that's really helpful!

Can you share the code you're using to reproduce the problem?

issue.title: [retry] don't start a new call attempt if the timer was cancelled

labels.name: release notes: no
labels.description: Indicates if PR should not be in release notes

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

body: I've sent #35729 with what I think is the right way to fix this, but I'd like to have a test to reproduce the problem if possible.

Hi! Thank you for looking into this.

Although i definitely could share the code for our reproducer, i'm afraid it would be of little use: it is a small application, built on top of web-framework of ours which, in turn, is built on top of grpc, and there also are envoy and wrk in the complete setup.
So yeah, it is a reproducible example, but it's far, far away from being minimal unfortunately, and i don't think i have a feasible way to reduce it.

However, i can share the binary with the core dump generated if you are interested.

----

On the bright side: i can confirm that your patch fixes the issue, thank you!

Is there a way to proceed further without a repro/test for this, or is it absolutely necessary for the fix to land?

Thanks for confirming that the fix works!

I would have liked to have a test along with the fix to prevent regressions, but it's not a blocker.  And it happens that in the not-too-distant future, we're going to redo all of the retry code anyway to use our promise library, so this is a short-term problem anyway.

I'll work on getting the PR merged.

issue.title: Continued crashes at grpc_core::ClientChannelFilter::LoadBalancedCall::PickSubchannelImpl(grpc_core::LoadBalancingPolicy::SubchannelPicker*, absl::lts_20240116::Status*) + 2961 (client_channel_filter.cc:2961)

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
@wu-hui flagged the grpc team to resolve [an open issue 12968 for Firestore crashes](https://github.com/firebase/firebase-ios-sdk/issues/12968) [[duplicate 13459](https://github.com/firebase/firebase-ios-sdk/issues/13459)]. Two recent grpc issue tickets were auto-closed without resolution [[37237](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/37237), [37821](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/37821)]. The [issue 34844](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/34844) contained a similar trace, more workup, and a PR against a race condition, but that fix did not resolve the broader problem.

### What version of gRPC and what language are you using?
1.62.0 (mysteriously also referenced as 1.62.5 in the Podfile.lock).

### What operating system (Linux, Windows,...) and version?
iOS 17/18

### What runtime / compiler are you using (e.g. python version or version of gcc)
Flutter

### What did you do?
Unable to reproduce, but see other reports.

### What did you see instead?
Crashing thread excerpted below. Here's [the full stack trace](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18302865/com.sbs.diet_issue_95e8d28960b607a07e39f4acb0d7a22f_crash_session_215a163911f44755a4429b7208c559bf_DNE_0_v2_stacktrace.txt). These crashes have been exclusively iPhone for us (not MacCatalyst) and occur across iOS 17 and 18 in mixed foreground and background states.

```
Crashed: com.google.firebase.firestore
EXC_BAD_ACCESS KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS 0x0000000000000000

          Crashed: com.google.firebase.firestore
0  grpc                           0xaefcc grpc_core::ClientChannelFilter::LoadBalancedCall::PickSubchannelImpl(grpc_core::LoadBalancingPolicy::SubchannelPicker*, absl::lts_20240116::Status*) + 2961 (client_channel_filter.cc:2961)
1  grpc                           0xaeb58 grpc_core::ClientChannelFilter::LoadBalancedCall::PickSubchannel(bool) + 2908 (client_channel_filter.cc:2908)
2  grpc                           0xb08ec grpc_core::ClientChannelFilter::FilterBasedLoadBalancedCall::TryPick(bool) + 463 (optional.h:463)
3  grpc                           0xafff8 grpc_core::ClientChannelFilter::FilterBasedLoadBalancedCall::StartTransportStreamOpBatch(grpc_transport_stream_op_batch*) + 3306 (client_channel_filter.cc:3306)
4  grpc                           0x1126cc grpc_core::ExecCtx::Flush() + 814 (status.h:814)
5  grpc                           0x10858 grpc_core::ExecCtx::~ExecCtx() + 131 (exec_ctx.h:131)
6  grpc                           0x36454 grpc_call_start_batch + 302 (exec_ctx.h:302)
7  FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x8fa70 grpc::internal::CallOpSet<grpc::internal::CallOpSendInitialMetadata, grpc::internal::CallOpSendMessage, grpc::internal::CallOpClientSendClose, grpc::internal::CallNoOp<4>, grpc::internal::CallNoOp<5>, grpc::internal::CallNoOp<6>>::ContinueFillOpsAfterInterception() + 971 (call_op_set.h:971)
8  FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x8dff0 grpc::ClientAsyncReaderWriter<grpc::ByteBuffer, grpc::ByteBuffer>::Write(grpc::ByteBuffer const&, grpc::WriteOptions, void*) + 578 (async_stream.h:578)
9  FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x93a00 firebase::firestore::remote::GrpcStream::MaybeWrite(absl::lts_20240116::optional<firebase::firestore::remote::internal::BufferedWrite>) + 647 (shared_ptr.h:647)
10 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x938fc firebase::firestore::remote::GrpcStream::Write(grpc::ByteBuffer&&) + 65 (optional.h:65)
11 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x154404 firebase::firestore::remote::WatchStream::WatchQuery(firebase::firestore::local::TargetData const&) + 97 (byte_buffer.h:97)
12 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x11b31c firebase::firestore::remote::RemoteStore::SendWatchRequest(firebase::firestore::local::TargetData const&) + 60 (target_data.h:60)
13 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x11b528 non-virtual thunk to firebase::firestore::remote::RemoteStore::OnWatchStreamOpen() + 237 (remote_store.cc:237)
14 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x12b304 firebase::firestore::remote::Stream::OnStreamStart() + 724 (shared_ptr.h:724)
15 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x12b258 firebase::firestore::remote::Stream::ResumeStartWithCredentials(firebase::firestore::util::StatusOr<firebase::firestore::credentials::AuthToken> const&, std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>> const&) + 182 (stream.cc:182)
16 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x12c898 std::__1::__function::__func<firebase::firestore::remote::Stream::RequestCredentials()::$_0::operator()(absl::lts_20240116::optional<firebase::firestore::util::StatusOr<firebase::firestore::credentials::AuthToken>> const&, absl::lts_20240116::optional<std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>>> const&) const::'lambda'(), std::__1::allocator<firebase::firestore::remote::Stream::RequestCredentials()::$_0::operator()(absl::lts_20240116::optional<firebase::firestore::util::StatusOr<firebase::firestore::credentials::AuthToken>> const&, absl::lts_20240116::optional<std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>>> const&) const::'lambda'()>, void ()>::operator()() + 156 (shared_ptr.h:156)
17 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x785c firebase::firestore::util::AsyncQueue::ExecuteBlocking(std::__1::function<void ()> const&) + 336 (cxx_atomic_impl.h:336)
18 FirebaseFirestoreInternal      0x13d11c firebase::firestore::util::Task::ExecuteAndRelease() + 188 (task.cc:188)
19 libdispatch.dylib              0x3fa8 _dispatch_client_callout + 20
20 libdispatch.dylib              0xb5cc _dispatch_lane_serial_drain + 768
21 libdispatch.dylib              0xc124 _dispatch_lane_invoke + 380
22 libdispatch.dylib              0x1738c _dispatch_root_queue_drain_deferred_wlh + 288
23 libdispatch.dylib              0x16bd8 _dispatch_workloop_worker_thread + 540
24 libsystem_pthread.dylib        0x3680 _pthread_wqthread + 288
25 libsystem_pthread.dylib        0x1474 start_wqthread + 8
        
```

### Anything else we should know about your project / environment?
Flutter 3.27.1 FirebaseFirestore 10.29.0
Podfile.lock excerpt
